translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Yes! Verily, there came to you My Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and you denied them, and were proud and were among the disbelievers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Yes indeed! My Verses did come to you, but you called them lies, turned arrogant, and were of the faithless.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Yes indeed! But My Signs came to you and you rejected them as lies, and waxed arrogant and were among those who disbelieved.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Yes! Verily, there came to you My Ayat and you denied them, and were proud and were among the disbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (But now the answer will be): Nay, for My revelations came unto thee, but thou didst deny them and wast scornful and wast among the disbelievers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [They will be told,] ‘Yes, My signs certainly came to you, but you denied them and acted arrogantly and you were among the faithless.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Indeed, My verses did come to you, but you belied them. You were proud and became one of the unbelievers'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But yes, there had come to you My verses, but you denied them and were arrogant, and you were among the disbelievers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God will reply to the soul, "My revelations had certainly come to you but you rejected them. You were puffed-up with pride and you became an unbeliever".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Aye! My communications came to you, but you rejected them, and you were proud and you were one of the unbelievers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bala qad jaatka ayatee fakaththabta biha waistakbarta wakunta mina alkafireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: No indeed! My revelations did come to you, but you rejected them: you showed arrogance, and were among those who deny the truth."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "(The reply will be:) 'Nay, but there came to thee my Signs, and thou didst reject them: thou wast Haughty, and became one of those who reject faith!'"

verses.text: وَ يَوْمَ‌ الْقِيَامَةِ تَرَى‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَذَبُوا عَلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ وُجُوهُهُمْ‌ مُسْوَدَّةٌ أَ لَيْسَ‌ فِي‌ جَهَنَّمَ‌ مَثْوًى‌ لِلْمُتَکَبِّرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و روز قیامت کسانی را که بر خدا دروغ بستند می بینی که صورت هایشان سیاه است؛ آیا در دوزخ جایگاهی برای متکبران نیست؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در روز قيامت، كسانى را كه به خدا دروغ بسته‌اند مى‌بينى كه رويشان سياه شده است. آيا متكبران را در جهنم جايگاهى نيست؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و روز قيامت كسانى را كه بر خدا دروغ بستند مى‌بينى روهايشان سياه است. آيا سركشان را جاى در دوزخ نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و روز قيامت كسانى را كه بر خدا دروغ بسته‌اند رو سياه مى‌بينى، آيا جاى سركشان در جهنم نيست؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و روز قیامت کسانی را که بر خدا دروغ بستند بنگری که همه رویشان سیاه شده است (رسوای خدا و خلق گردیدند) آیا متکبران را نه منزل در دوزخ است؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کسانی که بر خدا دروغ می‌بندند، روز قیامت آنان را خواهی دید که (بر اثر غم و اندوه و ذلّت و خواری) روهایشان سیاه است. مگر جایگاه متکبّران دوزخ نیست؟ [[«وُجُوهُهُم مُّسْوَدَّةٌ»: (نگا: آل‌عمران / 106، نحل / 58، زخرف / 17). «مَثْویً»: (نگا: آل‌عمران / 151، نحل / 29، عنکبوت / 68).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و روز قیامت کسانی را که بر خداوند دروغ بسته‌اند، بینی که چهره‌هایشان سیاه [شده‌] است [به آنان گویند] آیا منزلگاه متکبران در جهنم نیست؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و روز قیامت کسانی را که بر خدا دروغ بستند می‌بینی که صورتهایشان سیاه است؛ آیا در جهنّم جایگاهی برای متکبّران نیست؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و روز قیامت بینی آنان را که دروغ گفتند بر خدا رویهاشان سیاه شده آیا نیست در دوزخ جایگاهی برای کبرورزان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و روز رستاخيز آنان را كه بر خدا دروغ بستند- يعنى خداى را به گرفتن شريك و فرزند وصف كردند- بينى كه رويهاشان سياه است. آيا گردنكشان را جاى در دوزخ نيست؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و روز قیامت کسانی راکه بر خدا دروغ بستند روسیاه می‌بینی. آیا برای سرکشان پناهگاه و پایگاهی در جهنم نیست‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: If you see those who had imputed lies to God on the Day of Resurrection, black would be their faces (with disgrace). Is there not a place in Hell for the arrogant?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And you will see on the Day of Resurrection the fabricators of lies against Allah, with their faces blackened; is not the destination of the haughty in hell?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And upon the Day of Resurrection thou shalt see those who lied against God, their faces blackened; is there not in Gehenna a lodging for those that are proud?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And on the Day of Judgment thou Shalt see those who lied against Allah - their faces blackened. Is not in Hell the abode of the stiff-necked?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied against Allah (i.e. attributed to Him sons, partners, etc.) their faces will be black. Is there not in Hell an abode for the arrogant ones?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On the Day of Resurrection, you will see those who told lies about God with their faces blackened. Is there not a place in Hell for the arrogant?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On the Day of Resurrection you shall see that the faces of those who had lied against Allah have turned dark. Is Hell not vast enough to provide a room to the vainglorious?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied against Allah - their faces will be black. Is there not in Hell an abode for the arrogant

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And on the Day of Resurrection thou (Muhammad) seest those who lied concerning Allah with their faces blackened. Is not the home of the scorners in hell?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: On the Day of Resurrection you will see those who attributed lies to Allah with their faces blackened. Is not the [final] abode of the arrogant in hell?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On the Day of Resurrection, you shall see those who lied about Allah with blackened faces. In Gehenna is there not a lodging for those who were proud?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied about Allah [with] their faces blackened. Is there not in Hell a residence for the arrogant?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On the Day of Judgment you will see the faces of those who had invented falsehood against God blackened. Is not hell the dwelling of the arrogant ones?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And on the day of resurrection you shall see those who lied against Allah; their faces shall be blackened. Is there not in hell an abode for the proud?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wayawma alqiyamati tara allatheena kathaboo AAala Allahi wujoohuhum muswaddatun alaysa fee jahannama mathwan lilmutakabbireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On the Day of Resurrection you will see those who uttered falsehoods about God with their faces blackened. Is there not enough room in Hell for the arrogant?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: On the Day of Judgment wilt thou see those who told lies against Allah;- their faces will be turned black; Is there not in Hell an abode for the Haughty?

verses.text: وَ يُنَجِّي‌ اللَّهُ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ اتَّقَوْا بِمَفَازَتِهِمْ‌ لاَ يَمَسُّهُمُ‌ السُّوءُ وَ لاَ هُمْ‌ يَحْزَنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و خدا کسانی را که پرهیزکاری پیشه کردند، به سبب اعمالی که مایه رستگاری شان بود نجات می دهد، عذاب به آنان نمی رسد، و اندوهگین هم نمی شوند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خدا پرهيزكاران را به سبب راه رستگارى كه در پيش گرفته بودند مى‌رهاند. به آنها هيچ بدى نرسد و از اندوه بدور باشند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و خدا پرهيزگاران را به سبب كاميابى‌شان [در تقوا] نجات مى‌دهد. به آنها نه [هيچ گونه‌] بدى مى‌رسد و نه اندوهگين مى‌شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و خدا كسانى را كه تقوا پيشه كرده‌اند، به [پاس‌] كارهايى كه مايه رستگارى‌شان بوده، نجات مى‌دهد. عذاب به آنان نمى‌رسد و غمگين نخواهند گرديد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و خدا اهل تقوا را به موجبات رستگاری (و اعمال صالح) از عذاب نجات خواهد داد که هیچ رنج و المی به آنها نرسد و هرگز غم و اندوهی بر دلشان راه نیابد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خداوند کسانی را که تقوا پیشه کرده‌اند رهائی می‌بخشد و به مقصودشان می‌رساند. هیچ گونه بدی و بلائی بدیشان نمی‌رسد و غمگین و اندوهگین نمی‌گردند. [[«بِمَفَازَتِهِمْ»: مفازه، مصدر میمی و به معنی رستگاری و کامیاب شدن و به آرزو رسیدن است (نگا: آل‌عمران / 188، نبأ / 31). حرف (ب) برای ملابسه است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و خداوند کسانی را که پرهیزگاری ورزیده‌اند به رستگاری‌شان برهاند، چنانکه عذابی به آنان نرسد و اندوهگین هم نشوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و خداوند کسانی را که تقوا پیشه کردند با رستگاری رهایی می‌بخشد؛ هیچ بدی به آنان نمی‌رسد و هرگز غمگین نخواهند شد.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برهاند خدا آنان را که پرهیز کردند به پناهگاهشان نرسدشان بدی و نه اندوهگین شوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خداى كسانى را كه پرهيزگارى كردند با رستگارى و كاميابيشان برهاند، كه نه بدى بديشان رسد و نه اندوهگين شوند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و خدا کسانی را که تقوا پیشه کرده‌اند، نجات می‌دهد. بدی به آنان نمی‌رسد و غمگین (هم) نخواهند گردید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: God would rescue those who fear Him (and guide them) to places of safety. Neither will evil touch them nor regret.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And Allah will rescue the pious, to their place of salvation; neither will the punishment touch them, nor shall they grieve.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But God shall deliver those that were godfearing in their security; evil shall not visit them, neither shall they sorrow.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Allah will deliver those who feared Him to their place of safety. Evil will not touch them, nor will they grieve.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And Allah will deliver those who are the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2) to their places of success (Paradise). Evil shall touch them not, nor shall they grieve.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And God will save those who maintained righteousness to their place of salvation. No harm will touch them, nor will they grieve.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But as for the God-fearing, Allah will deliver them on account of their achievements: no harm shall visit them nor shall they grieve.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And Allah will deliver those who have Taqwa to their places of success. Evil shall touch them not, nor shall they grieve.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Allah delivereth those who ward off (evil) because of their deserts. Evil toucheth them not, nor do they grieve.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Allah will deliver those who were Godwary with their salvation. No ill shall touch them, nor will they grieve.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But, Allah will save those who fear Him with their winnings (Paradise). No evil shall touch them, nor shall they ever grieve.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Allah will save those who feared Him by their attainment; no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God will save the pious ones because of their virtuous deeds. No hardship will touch them nor will they be grieved.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Allah shall deliver those who guard (against evil) with their achievement; evil shall not touch them, nor shall they grieve.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wayunajjee Allahu allatheena ittaqaw bimafazatihim la yamassuhumu alssooo wala hum yahzanoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But God will deliver them who feared Him to their place of salvation. No evil shall touch them, nor shall they grieve.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But Allah will deliver the righteous to their place of salvation: no evil shall touch them, nor shall they grieve.

verses.text: اللَّهُ‌ خَالِقُ‌ کُلِ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ وَ هُوَ عَلَى‌ کُلِ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ وَکِيلٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: خدا آفریننده هر چیزی است و او بر هر چیزی نگهبان و کارساز است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خداست كه آفريدگار هر چيزى است و او نگهبان هر چيزى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: خدا آفريدگار همه چيز است، و همو نگهبان همه چيز است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: خدا آفريدگار هر چيزى است، و اوست كه بر هر چيز نگهبان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا آفریننده هر چیز است و بر هر چیز هم او نگهبان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خدا آفریدگار همه چیز است و همه چیز را می‌پاید و مراقبت می‌نماید. [[«وَکِیلٌ»: عهده‌دار و نگاهدار. ناظر و مراقب (نگا: آل‌عمران / 173، انعام / 66 و 102 و 107).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: خداوند آفریدگار همه چیز است، و او بر هر چیزی نگهبان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: خداوند آفریدگار همه چیز است و حافظ و ناظر بر همه اشیا است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: خدا است آفریدگار هر چیزی و اوست بر همه چیز وکیل‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: خداست آفريدگار هر چيزى، و او بر همه چيز كارساز و نگاهبان است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: خدا آفریدگار هرچیزی است ، و او بر هر چیزی پاسدار (و) کاردار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: God is the creator of all things, and He is the guarantor of all things.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Allah is Creator of all things; and He only is the Controller of all things.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: God is the Creator of every thing; He is Guardian over every thing;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Allah is the Creator everything, And He is over everything a Trustee.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the Wakil (Trustee, Disposer of affairs, Guardian, etc.) over all things.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: God is the Creator of all things, and He is in Charge of all things.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Allah is the Creator of everything; He is the Guardian over everything.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the Trustee over all things.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Allah is Creator of all things, and He is Guardian over all things.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Allah is creator of all things, and He watches over all things.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Allah is the Creator of all things, and of all things He is the Guardian.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God is the Creator and Guardian of all things.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Allah is the Creator of every thing and He has charge over every thing.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Allahu khaliqu kulli shayin wahuwa AAala kulli shayin wakeelun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God is the Creator of all things, He has charge of everything;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the Guardian and Disposer of all affairs.

verses.text: لَهُ‌ مَقَالِيدُ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ الْأَرْضِ‌ وَ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ أُولٰئِکَ‌ هُمُ‌ الْخَاسِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: کلیدهای آسمان ها و زمیندر مالکیّت اوست، و کسانی که به آیات خدا کفر ورزیدند، هم آنان زیانکارند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كليدهاى آسمانها و زمين نزد اوست و آنها كه به آيات خدا كافر شده‌اند زيان‌ديدگان هستند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كليدهاى آسمان‌ها و زمين از آن اوست، و كسانى كه آيات خدا را انكار كردند آنها حقا زيانكارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كليدهاى آسمان و زمين از آن اوست، و كسانى كه نشانه‌هاى خدا را انكار كردند، آنانند كه زيانكارانند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: کلیدهای خزائن آسمانها و زمین او راست و آنان که به آیات خدا کافر شدند هم آنان زیانکاران عالمند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کلیدهای آسمانها و زمین از آن او است. کسانی که آیات خدا را باور نمی‌دارند ایشان زیانکارند. (چرا که قوانین و رهنمودهای کسی را نمی‌پذیرند که مالک و صاحب سراسر جهان و فرمانده و گرداننده‌ی آن است). [[«مَقَالِیدُ»: جمع مِقْلاد، کلیدها. «لَهُ مَقَالِیدُ ...»: کنایه از مالکیّت و حاکمیّت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: او راست کلیدهای آسمانها و زمین، کسانی که آیات ما را انکار کرده‌اند، آنانند که زیانکارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: کلیدهای آسمانها و زمین از آن اوست؛ و کسانی که به آیات خداوند کافر شدند زیانکارانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: وی را است کلیدهای آسمانها و زمین و آنان که کفر ورزیدند به آیتهای خدا ایشانند زیانکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: او راست كليدهاى [گنجينه‌هاى‌] آسمانها و زمين و آنان كه به نشانه‌هاى خدا كافر شدند همانان زيانكارانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: درب‌های بسته و پیوسته‌‌ی آسمان‌ها و زمین تنها از اوست. و کسانی که به نشانه‌های خدا کفر ورزیدند ایشان خودشان زیانکارانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He has the keys of the heavens and the earth; and those who deny the revelations of God will be losers.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: For Him only are the keys of the heavens and the earth; and those who denied the signs of Allah – it is they who are the losers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: unto Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And those who disbelieve in the signs of God, those they are the losers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: His are the keys of the heavens and the earth and those who disbelieve in the revelations of Allah-those! they are the losers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And those who disbelieve in the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, signs, revelations, etc.) of Allah, such are they who will be the losers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: To Him belong the reins of the heavens and the earth. But those who blaspheme against the revelations of God—it is they who are the losers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. It is those who disbelieve in Allah's Signs who will be the losers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: To Him belong the Maqalid of the heavens and the earth. And those who disbelieve in the Ayat of Allah, such are they who will be the losers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: His are the keys of the heavens and the earth, and they who disbelieve the revelations of Allah - such are they who are the losers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth, and those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah—it is they who are the losers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. Those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah they are the losers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And they who disbelieve in the verses of Allah - it is those who are the losers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In His hands are the keys of the treasuries of the heavens and the earth. Those who reject God's revelations will be lost.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: His are the treasures of the heavens and the earth; and (as for) those who disbelieve in the communications of Allah, these it is that are the losers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lahu maqaleedu alssamawati waalardi waallatheena kafaroo biayati Allahi olaika humu alkhasiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: the keys of the heavens and the earth belong to Him. Those who deny God's revelations will surely be the losers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth: and those who reject the Signs of Allah,- it is they who will be in loss.

verses.text: قُلْ‌ أَ فَغَيْرَ اللَّهِ‌ تَأْمُرُونِّي‌ أَعْبُدُ أَيُّهَا الْجَاهِلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: ای نادانان! آیا به من فرمان می دهید که غیر خدا را بپرستم؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اى نادانان، آيا مرا فرمان مى‌دهيد كه غير از خدا را بپرستم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: آيا مرا وادار مى‌كنيد كه غير خدا را بپرستم اى نادان‌ها

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اى نادانان، آيا مرا وادار مى‌كنيد كه جز خدا را بپرستم؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول به مشرکان) بگو: ای مردم نادان مرا امر می‌کنید که غیر خدا را پرستش کنم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: ای نادانان! آیا به من دستور می‌دهید که غیر خدا را پرستش کنم؟! [[«أَفَغَیْرَ اللهِ ...»: مشرکان با لحنی آمرانه و بدون ذکر دلیل و منطق از پیغمبر می‌خواستند بتهای ایشان را پرستش نماید تا بدو ایمان بیاورند و از او پیروی کنند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو ای نادانان آیا فرمانم می‌دهید که غیر از خدا را بپرستم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «آیا به من دستور می‌دهید که غیر خدا را بپرستم ای جاهلان؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو آیا جز خدا را فرمان دهیدم که پرستم ای نادانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: آيا مرا مى‌فرماييد كه جز خداى را بپرستم، اى نادانان؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «هان ای نادانان! آیا پس مرا وادار می‌کنید که جز خدا را بپرستم‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "O you ignorant people, do you bid me to worship someone other than God?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) “So do you instruct me to worship (deities) other than Allah? You ignorant fools!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'Is it other than God you bid me serve, you ignorant ones?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: is it other than Allah that ye command me to worship! O ye pagans

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW to the polytheists, etc.): "Do you order me to worship other than Allah O you fools?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “Is it other than God you instruct me to worship, you ignorant ones?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (O Prophet), say: “Ignorant people! Do you bid me to serve any other beside Allah?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "Do you order me to worship other than Allah O you fools!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): Do ye bid me serve other than Allah? O ye fools!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘Will you, then, bid me to worship other than Allah, O you ignorant ones?!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'O you who are ignorant, is it other than Allah that you would order me to worship'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, [O Muhammad], "Is it other than Allah that you order me to worship, O ignorant ones?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), say, "Ignorant ones, do you command me to worship things other than God

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: What! Do you then bid me serve others than Allah, O ignorant men?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul afaghayra Allahi tamuroonnee aAAbudu ayyuha aljahiloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "Ignorant men! Would you bid me worship someone other than God?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "Is it some one other than Allah that ye order me to worship, O ye ignorant ones?"

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ أُوحِيَ‌ إِلَيْکَ‌ وَ إِلَى‌ الَّذِينَ‌ مِنْ‌ قَبْلِکَ‌ لَئِنْ‌ أَشْرَکْتَ‌ لَيَحْبَطَنَ‌ عَمَلُکَ‌ وَ لَتَکُونَنَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْخَاسِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید به تو و به کسانی که پیش از تو بوده اند، وحی شده است که اگر مشرک شوی، همه اعمالت تباه و بی اثر می شود و از زیانکاران خواهی بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به تو و پيامبران پيش از تو وحى شده است كه اگر شرك بياوريد اعمالتان ناچيز گردد و خود از زيان‌كنندگان خواهيد بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و قطعا به تو و كسانى كه پيش از تو بودند وحى شده است كه اگر شرك ورزى مسلما عمل تو تباه مى‌شود و بى‌شك از زيانكاران مى‌شوى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قطعاً به تو و به كسانى كه پيش از تو بودند وحى شده است: «اگر شرك ورزى حتماً كردارت تباه و مسلماً از زيانكاران خواهى شد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (هنوز مشرکان جاهل از تو موحد کامل طمع شرک دارند؟) و حال آنکه به تو و به رسولان پیش از تو چنین وحی شده که اگر به خدا شرک آوری عملت محو و نابود می‌گردد و سخت از زیانکاران خواهی گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به تو و به یکایک پیغمبران پیش از تو وحی شده است که اگر شرک‌ورزی کردارت (باطل و بی‌پاداش می‌گردد و) هیچ و نابود می‌شود، و از زیانکاران خواهی بود. [[«لإِنْ أَشْرَکْتَ ...»: پیغمبران معصومند و شرک نمی‌ورزند. چنین خطابی گوشه زدن به دیگران است. «لَیَحْبَطَنَّ»: قطعاً هیچ و نابود و بی‌پاداش و بیسود می‌شود (نگا: بقره / 217، آل‌عمران / 22، مائده / 53).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی بر تو و بر کسانی که پیش از تو بوده‌اند، وحی شده است که اگر شرک ورزی، عملت تباه گردد، و بی‌شک از زیانکاران باشی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به تو و همه پیامبران پیشین وحی شده که اگر مشرک شوی، تمام اعمالت تباه می‌شود و از زیانکاران خواهی بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر آینه وحی شد بسوی تو و بسوی آنان که پیش از تو بودند که اگر شرک ورزی هر آینه تباه شود کردارت و همانا شوی از زیانکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه به تو وحى شده است، و نيز به آنان كه پيش از تو بودند، كه اگر شرك‌ورزى بى‌گمان كار تو تباه و نابود گردد و از زيانكاران باشى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی و درستی به تو و به کسانی که پیش از تو بودند وحی شده است: «اگر شرک بورزی همانا کردارت به‌راستی تباه است و بی‌امان و بی‌چون از زیانکاران خواهی بود.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Surely you have been commanded, as those before you were: "If you associate (any one with God), wasted will be all your deeds, arid you will perish."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And it was indeed revealed to you and to those before you; that, “O listener! If you ascribe a partner to Allah, all your deeds will go to waste and you will surely be a loser.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It has been revealed to thee, and to those before thee, 'If thou associatest other gods with God, thy work shall surely fail and thou wilt be among the losers.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly it hath been revealed Unto thee and Unto those before thee: if thou associatest surely of non-effect shall be made thy work, and thou shalt surely be of the losers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed it has been revealed to you (O Muhammad SAW), as it was to those (Allah's Messengers) before you: "If you join others in worship with Allah, (then) surely (all) your deeds will be in vain, and you will certainly be among the losers."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It was revealed to you, and to those before you, that if you idolize, your works will be in vain, and you will be of the losers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (Tell them clearly that) it was revealed to you and to all Prophets before you: “If you associate any others with Allah in His Divinity, your works will surely come to naught and you will certainly be among the losers.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed it has been revealed to you, as it was to those before you: "If you join others in worship with Allah, surely your deeds will be in vain, and you will certainly be among the losers."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily it hath been revealed unto thee as unto those before thee (saying): If thou ascribe a partner to Allah thy work will fail and thou indeed wilt be among the losers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly it has been revealed to you and to those [who have been] before you: ‘If you ascribe a partner to Allah your works shall fail and you shall surely be among the losers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It has already been revealed to you and to those who have gone before you, that if you associate (partners) with Allah, your works would be annulled and you will be among the losers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And it was already revealed to you and to those before you that if you should associate [anything] with Allah, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: even though God has said, "It has been revealed to you and to those who lived before you that if you consider other things equal to God, your deeds will be made devoid of all virtue and you will certainly be lost?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly, it has been revealed to you and to those before you: Surely if you associate (with Allah), your work would certainly come to naught and you would certainly be of the losers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad oohiya ilayka waila allatheena min qablika lain ashrakta layahbatanna AAamaluka walatakoonanna mina alkhasireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It has already been revealed to you and to those who have gone before you that if you ascribe any partner to God, all your works will come to nothing, and you will surely be among the losers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But it has already been revealed to thee,- as it was to those before thee,- "If thou wert to join (gods with Allah), truly fruitless will be thy work (in life), and thou wilt surely be in the ranks of those who lose (all spiritual good)".

verses.text: بَلِ‌ اللَّهَ‌ فَاعْبُدْ وَ کُنْ‌ مِنَ‌ الشَّاکِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بلکه فقط خدا را بپرست و از سپاس گزاران باش.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بلكه خدا را بپرست و سپاسگزار او باش.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه [تنها] خدا را پرستش كن و از سپاسگزاران باش

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بلكه خدا را بپرست و از سپاسگزاران باش.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلکه تنها خدا را پرستش کن و از شکر گزاران (نعمت الهی) باش.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس در این صورت تنها خدا را بپرست و از زمره‌ی سپاسگزاران باش. [[«اللهَ»: مفعول مقدّم (أُعْبُدْ) و تقدیم آن برای حصر است. «بَلْ ...»: پس در این صورت. با توجّه به این.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بلکه خداوند را بپرست و از سپاسگزاران باش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بلکه تنها خداوند را عبادت کن و از شکرگزاران باش!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بلکه خدا را پرستش کن و باش از سپاس‌گزاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بلكه تنها خداى را بپرست و از سپاسداران باش.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «بلکه تنها خدا را بپرست و از سپاسگزاران باش.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So, you should worship only God, arid be among the grateful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: But rather worship only Allah, and be among the thankful!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Nay, but God do thou serve; and be thou among the thankful.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Aye! Allah must thou worship, and be among the thankful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay! But worship Allah (Alone and none else), and be among the grateful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Rather, worship God, and be of the appreciative.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Therefore, serve Allah alone and be among those who give thanks.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay! But worship Allah, and be among the grateful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but Allah must thou serve, and be among the thankful!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No, worship Allah, and be among the grateful!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No, worship Allah and be with those who give thanks!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Rather, worship [only] Allah and be among the grateful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), You must worship God alone and give Him thanks.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay! but serve Allah alone and be of the thankful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bali Allaha faoAAbud wakun mina alshshakireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Therefore, you should worship God alone and be among the thankful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nay, but worship Allah, and be of those who give thanks.

verses.text: وَ مَا قَدَرُوا اللَّهَ‌ حَقَ‌ قَدْرِهِ‌ وَ الْأَرْضُ‌ جَمِيعاً قَبْضَتُهُ‌ يَوْمَ‌ الْقِيَامَةِ وَ السَّمَاوَاتُ‌ مَطْوِيَّاتٌ‌ بِيَمِينِهِ‌ سُبْحَانَهُ‌ وَ تَعَالَى‌ عَمَّا يُشْرِکُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و خدا را آن گونه که سزاوار اوست نشناختند، در حالی که زمین در روز قیامت یکسره در قبضه قدرت اوست، و آسمان ها هم درهم پیچیده به دست اوست؛ منزّه و برتر است از آنچه با او شریک می گیرند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خدا را نشناختند آنچنان كه شايان شناخت اوست. و در روز قيامت، زمين يكجا در قبضه اوست و آسمانها در هم پيچيده، در يد قدرت او. منزه است و برتر از هر چه شريك او مى‌پندارند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و خدا را آن چنان كه بايد ارج ننهادند، حال آن كه در روز قيامت زمين يكجا در قبضه او و آسمان‌ها پيچيده شده به دست اوست. او منزّه است و برتر از آنچه [با وى‌] شريك مى‌گردانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و خدا را آنچنان كه بايد به بزرگى نشناخته‌اند، و حال آنكه روز قيامت زمين يكسره در قبضه [قدرت‌] اوست، و آسمانها در پيچيده به دست اوست؛ او منزّه است و برتر است از آنچه [با وى‌] شريك مى‌گردانند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (آنان که غیر خدا را طلبیدند) خدا را چنان که شاید به عظمت نشناختند، و اوست که روز قیامت زمین در قبضه قدرت او و آسمانها در پیچیده به دست سلطنت اوست. آن ذات پاک یکتا منزّه و متعالی از شرک مشرکان (بلکه از فکر موحدان) است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان آن گونه که شایسته است خدا را نشناخته‌اند (این است که تو را به شرک می‌خوانند. خدا آن کسی است که) در روز قیامت سراسر کره‌ی زمین یکباره در مشت او قرار دارد و آسمانها با دست راست او در هم پیچیده می‌شود. خدا پاک و منزّه از شرک آنان (و دورِ دور از انبازهای ایشان و فراتر از اندیشه‌ی انسان) است. [[«مَا قَدَرُوا اللهَ حَقَّ قَدْرِهِ»: (نگا: انعام / 91، حجّ / 74). «قَبْضَتُهُ»: قبض به معنی در مشت گرفتن است و اینجا به معنی (مَقبوض) یعنی (در مشت) است. مراد این است که همه زمین در قبضه قدرت و تحت تصرّف او است. «مَطْوِیَّاتٌ»: در پیچیده‌ها. در هم نوردیده‌ها. (نگا: انبیاء / 104). «بِیَمِینِهِ»: با دست راست او. انتخاب دست راست بدان خاطر است که اغلب مردم کارهای مهمّ را با دست راست انجام می‌دهند و قوّت و قدرت بیشتری در آن احساس می‌کنند. همه این تشبیهات و تعبیرات، کنایه از سلطه مطلق پروردگار بر عالم هستی است و این سلطه در جهان دیگر برای انسانها محسوستر و آشکارتر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و خداوند را چنانکه سزاوار قدر اوست ارج ننهادند، حال آنکه سراسر زمین در روز قیامت در قبضه قدرت اوست، و آسمانها به دست او درهم نوردیده می‌گردد، منزه است او و فراتر است از آنچه برای او شریک می‌دانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها خدا را آن گونه که شایسته است نشناختند، در حالی که تمام زمین در روز قیامت در قبضه اوست و آسمانها پیچیده در دست او؛ خداوند منزّه و بلندمقام است از شریکیهایی که برای او می‌پندارند

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و ارج نگذاشتند خدا را حقّ ارجمندیش و زمین همگی در چنگ او است روز قیامت و آسمانها پیچیده‌اند به دستش منزّه و برتر است او از آنچه شرک ورزند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خداى را چنانكه شايسته اوست نشناختند، و روز رستاخيز زمين يكسره در قبضه [قدرت‌] اوست و آسمانها به دست راست- يعنى به قدرت- او پيچيده شوند پاك است او، و برتر است از آنكه با او انباز مى‌گيرند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و خدا را ‎آنچنان که شایسته‌ی قدر و منزلتش می‌باشد قدر ندانستند. حال آنکه روز قیامت زمین یکسره در قبضه‌ی (علم و قدرت و حکمت) اوست، و آسمان‌ها در هم پیچیده به دست توانای اوست. او منزه و برتر است از آنچه (با وی) شریک می‌گردانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They do not esteem God as is rightly due to Him. The whole earth would be a fistful of His on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens would be rolled up in His right hand. Too immaculate is He and too high for what they associate with Him!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they did not realise the importance of Allah as was His right; and on the Day of Resurrection, He will compress the lands and the heavens will be rolled up by His power; Purity and Supremacy are to Him, from all what they ascribe as partners.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They measure not God with His true measure. The earth altogether shall be His handful on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens shall be rolled up in His right hand. Glory be to Him! High be He exalted above that they associate!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they estimated not Allah with an estimation due Unto Him whereas the whole earth shall be His handful on the Day of Judgment, and the heavens shall be rolled in His right hand. Hallowed be He and Exalted above that which they associate.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They made not a just estimate of Allah such as is due to Him. And on the Day of Resurrection the whole of the earth will be grasped by His Hand and the heavens will be rolled up in His Right Hand. Glorified is He, and High is He above all that they associate as partners with Him!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They have not esteemed God as He ought to be esteemed. The entire earth will be in His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His righ. Immaculate is He, and Transcendent He is beyond the associations they make.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They did not recognise the true worth of Allah. (Such is Allah's power that) on the Day of Resurrection the whole earth will be in His grasp, and the heavens shall be folded up in His Right Hand. Glory be to Him! Exalted be He from all that they associate with Him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They made not a just estimate of Allah such as is due to Him. And on the Day of Resurrection the whole of the earth will be grasped by His Hand and the heavens will be rolled up in His Right Hand. Glorified be He, and High be He above all that they associate as partners with Him!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they esteem not Allah as He hath the right to be esteemed, when the whole earth is His handful on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens are rolled in His right hand. Glorified is He and High Exalted from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They do not regard Allah with the regard due to Him, yet the entire earth will be in His fist on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens, scrolled, in His right hand. Immaculate is He and exalted above [having] any partners that they ascribe [to Him].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They have not valued Allah with His true value. But on the Day of Resurrection, the entire earth will be in His grip, and the heavens shall be rolled up upon in His Right. Exaltations to Him! Exalted high is He above all that they associate!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal, while the earth entirely will be [within] His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They have not paid due respect to God. The whole earth will be gripped in His hands on the Day of Judgment and the heavens will be just like a scroll in His right hand. God is too Glorious and High to be considered equal to their idols.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they have not honored Allah with the honor that is due to Him; and the whole earth shall be in His grip on the day of resurrection and the heavens rolled up in His right hand; glory be to Him, and may He be exalted above what they associate (with Him).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama qadaroo Allaha haqqa qadrihi waalardu jameeAAan qabdatuhu yawma alqiyamati waalssamawatu matwiyyatun biyameenihi subhanahu wataAAala AAamma yushrikoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: No just estimate have they made of God, such as is due to Him. But on the Day of Resurrection, the whole earth will lie within His grasp, while heaven will be folded up in His right hand -- Glory be to Him! Exalted is He above all that they associate with Him --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: No just estimate have they made of Allah, such as is due to Him: On the Day of Judgment the whole of the earth will be but His handful, and the heavens will be rolled up in His right hand: Glory to Him! High is He above the Partners they attribute to Him!

verses.text: وَ نُفِخَ‌ فِي‌ الصُّورِ فَصَعِقَ‌ مَنْ‌ فِي‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ مَنْ‌ فِي‌ الْأَرْضِ‌ إِلاَّ مَنْ‌ شَاءَ اللَّهُ‌ ثُمَ‌ نُفِخَ‌ فِيهِ‌ أُخْرَى‌ فَإِذَا هُمْ‌ قِيَامٌ‌ يَنْظُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و در صور دمیده می شود، پس هر که در آسمان ها و زمین است می میرد، مگر کسی را که خدا بخواهد، آن گاه بار دیگر در صور دمیده می شود، ناگاه همه آنان بر پای ایستاده [مات و مبهوت به هر سو] می نگرند [که سرانجام کارشان چه خواهد شد!]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و در صور دميده شود. پس هر كه در آسمانها و هر كه در زمين است -جز آنها كه او بخواهد- بيهوش مى‌شوند. و بار ديگر در آن دميده شود، ناگهان از جاى برمى‌خيزند و مى‌نگرند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در صور دميده شود، پس هر كه در آسمان‌ها و هر كه در زمين است بى‌جان افتد، مگر كسى كه خدا بخواهد. سپس بار ديگر در آن دميده شود و به ناگاه آنها به پا خيزند و [با نگرانى‌] نگاه كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در صور دميده مى‌شود، پس هر كه در آسمانها و هر كه در زمين است بيهوش درمى‌افتد، مگر كسى كه خدا بخواهد؛ سپس بار ديگر در آن دميده مى‌شود و بناگاه آنان بر پاى ايستاده مى‌نگرند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و صیحه‌ای در صور (اسرافیل) بدمند تا جز آن که خدا (بقای او) خواسته دیگر هر که در آسمانها و زمین است همه یکسر مدهوش مرگ شوند، آن گاه صیحه دیگری در آن دمیده شود که ناگاه خلایق همه (از خواب مرگ) بر خیزند و نظاره (واقعه محشر) کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در صور دمیده خواهد شد و تمام کسانی که در آسمانها و زمین هستند می‌میرند مگر کسانی که خدا بخواهد (آنان را تا زمان دیگری زنده بدارد). سپس بار دیگر در آن دمیده می‌شود، به ناگاه همگی (جان می‌گیرند و) بپا می‌خیزند و می‌نگرند (تا در حق ایشان چه شود و حساب و کتابشان کی انجام پذیرد و سرنوشتشان به کجا بینجامد). [[«الصُّورِ»: (نگا: انعام / 73، کهف / 99، طه / 102). «صَعِقَ»: مُرد (نگا: طور / 45). «مَن شَآءَ اللهُ»: قرآن و خبر صحیح مشخّص نفرموده‌اند مراد از چنین افرادی که مستثنی هستند چه کسانی می‌باشند (نگا: المراغی). «قِیَامٌ»: جمع قائِم، ایستادگان. «یَنظُرُونَ»: چشم به راه حساب و کتاب و سزا و جزا و شقاوت و سعادت ابدی خویش هستند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و در صور دمیده شود، سپس هر کس که در آسمانها و هر کس که در زمین است، بیهوش شود، مگر آنکه خدا خواهد، سپس بار دیگر در آن دمیده شود، آنگاه ایشان [انسانها] ایستادگانی چشم به راهند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در «صور» دمیده می‌شود، پس همه کسانی که در آسمانها و زمینند می‌میرند، مگر کسانی که خدا بخواهد؛ سپس بار دیگر در «صور» دمیده می‌شود، ناگهان همگی به پا می‌خیزند و در انتظار (حساب و جزا) هستند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و دمیده شد در صور پس بیهوش افتاده‌اند آنان که در آسمانها و آنان که در زمین‌اند مگر آنکه خواست خدا سپس دمیده شد در آن بار دیگر ناگاه ایشانند ایستادگانی نگران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و در صور دميده شود، پس هر كه در آسمانها و هر كه در زمين است بيهوش شود- بميرد- مگر آنان كه خداى خواهد، سپس بار ديگر در آن دميده شود، پس ناگهان ايستادگانى باشند كه مى‌نگرند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و در صور [:بوق جانکاه] دمیده شد. پس هر که در آسمان‌ها و هر که در زمین است بیهوش در افتاد مگر کسی که خدا خواسته. سپس بار دیگر در آن (بوق جان‌خواه) دمیده شد. پس به‌ناگاه آنان (بر پای) ایستاد‌گان می‌نگرند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When the trumpet blast is sounded whoever is in the heavens and the earth will swoon away, except those God please. When the blast is sounded the second time, they will stand up all expectant.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And the Trumpet will be blown, so everyone in the heavens and everyone in the earth will fall unconscious, except whomever* Allah wills; it will then be blown again, thereupon they will get up staring! (*Prophet Moosa and / or some angels).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: For the Trumpet shall be blown, and whosoever is in the heavens and whosoever is in the earth shall swoon, save whom God wills. Then it shall be blown again, and lo, they shall stand, beholding.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the trumpet will be blown, when whosoever are in the heavens and whosoever are on the earth will swoon away, save him whomsoever Allah willeth. Then it shall be blown again, and lo! They will be standing, looking on.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And the Trumpet will be blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth will swoon away, except him whom Allah will. Then it will blown a second time and behold, they will be standing, looking on (waiting).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the Trumpet will be sounded, whereupon everyone in the heavens and the earth will be stunned, except whomever God wills. Then it will be sounded another time, whereupon they will rise up, looking on.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And the Trumpet shall be blown and all who are in the heavens and the earth shall fall down dead save those whom Allah wills. Then the Trumpet shall be blown again, and lo! all of them will be standing and looking on.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And the Trumpet will be blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth will swoon away, except him whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown another time, and behold they will be standing, looking on.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the trumpet is blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are in the earth swoon away, save him whom Allah willeth. Then it is blown a second time, and behold them standing waiting!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And the Trumpet will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens will swoon and whoever is on the earth, except whomever Allah wishes. Then it will be blown a second time, behold, they will rise up, looking on!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The Horn shall be blown and all who are in heavens and earth shall swoon, except those whom Allah wills. Then, the Horn will blow again and they shall stand and gaze.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Everyone in the heavens and the earth will faint in terror except for those whom God will save when the trumpet is sounded. They will all stand up and wait when the trumpet sounds for the second time.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the trumpet shall be blown, so all those that are in the heavens and all those that are in the earth shall swoon, except such as Allah please; then it shall be blown again, then lo! they shall stand up awaiting.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanufikha fee alssoori fasaAAiqa man fee alssamawati waman fee alardi illa man shaa Allahu thumma nufikha feehi okhra faitha hum qiyamun yanthuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: the Trumpet shall be blown and whoever is in heaven and whoever is on earth will fall down in a swoon, except those who shall be spared by God. Then the trumpet will be blown again and they shall rise and gaze around them.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The Trumpet will (just) be sounded, when all that are in the heavens and on earth will swoon, except such as it will please Allah (to exempt). Then will a second one be sounded, when, behold, they will be standing and looking on!

verses.text: وَ أَشْرَقَتِ‌ الْأَرْضُ‌ بِنُورِ رَبِّهَا وَ وُضِعَ‌ الْکِتَابُ‌ وَ جِي‌ءَ بِالنَّبِيِّينَ‌ وَ الشُّهَدَاءِ وَ قُضِيَ‌ بَيْنَهُمْ‌ بِالْحَقِ‌ وَ هُمْ‌ لاَ يُظْلَمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و زمین به نور پروردگارش روشن می شود، و کتاب [اعمال] را می نهند، و پیامبران و گواهان را بیاورند ومیانشان به حقّ وراستی داوری شود، وآنان مورد ستم قرار نمی گیرند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و زمين به نور پروردگارش روشن شود و نامه‌هاى اعمال را بنهند و پيامبران و گواهان را بياورند و در ميان مردم به حق داورى شود و بر كسى ستمى نرود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و زمين به نور پروردگارش روشن گردد، و كارنامه [اعمال در ميان‌] نهاده شود، و پيامبران و شاهدان را بياورند، و ميانشان به حق داورى گردد و بر آنان ستم نرود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و زمين به نور پروردگارش روشن گردد، و كارنامه [اعمال در ميان‌] نهاده شود، و پيامبران و شاهدان را بياورند، و ميانشان به حق داورى گردد، و مورد ستم قرار نگيرند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و زمین (محشر) به نور پروردگار خود روشن گردد و نامه (اعمال خلق در پیشگاه عدل حق) نهاده شود و انبیاء و شهداء (بر گواهی) احضار شوند و میان خلق به حق حکم شود و به هیچ کس ابدا ظلمی نخواهد شد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و زمین (محشر و عرصات قیامت) با نور (تجلّی) خداوندگارش روشن می‌شود، و کتاب (و نامه‌ی اعمال به دست صاحبانش) گذاشته می‌شود و پیغمبران و گواهان آورده می‌شوند، و راست و درست میان مردم داوری می‌گردد، و اصلاً بدیشان ستم نمی‌شود. [[«أَشْرَقَتْ»: روشن شد. تابان گردید. «الأرْضُ»: مراد زمین محشر و گستره قیامت است. «بِنُورِ رَبِّهَا»: با نور خداوندگارش. مراد از نور خدا، پرتو تجلّی است (نگا: اعراف / 143). بعضیها نور را کنایه از عدل و داد الهی گرفته‌اند که محشر را نورانی می‌کند. «وُضِعَ الْکِتَابُ»: نامه اعمال به دست صاحبان آن داده می‌شود (نگا: اسراء / 13 و 14، کهف / 49). «الشُّهَدَآءِ»: جمع شهید، گواهان. مراد انبیاء (نگا: نساء / 41، قصص / 75) و علماء و راهنمایان امت محمّدی (نگا: بقره / 143) و فرشتگان است (نگا: نساء / 166، ق / 21، انفطار / 10 - 12). در صورت اوّل، عطف (الشُّهَدَآءِ) بر (النَّبِیِّینَ) از قبیل عطف عامّ بر خاصّ است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سراسر عرصه محشر به نور پروردگارش درخشان گردد و نامه اعمال در میان نهند و پیامبران و گواهان را به میان آورند و بین مردم به حق داوری شود و بر آنان ستم نرود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و زمین (در آن روز) به نور پروردگارش روشن می‌شود، و نامه‌های اعمال را پیش می‌نهند و پیامبران و گواهان را حاضر می‌سازند، و میان آنها بحق داوری می‌شود و به آنان ستم نخواهد شد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و درخشید زمین به نور پروردگار خویش و گذارده شد کتاب و آورده شدند پیغمبران و گواهان و داوری شد میان آنان به حقّ و ایشان ستم نشوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [در آن روز] زمين به نور خداوند خود روشن شود و نامه [هاى اعمال‌] را پيش نهند و پيامبران و گواهان را بياورند و ميان ايشان- آدميان- براستى و درستى داورى شود و بر آنان ستم نرود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و زمین به نور پروردگارش روشن شد و کتاب (وحی و اعمال در میان) نهاده گشت و پیامبران و شاهدان آورده شدند و میانشان بحق داوری گشت، در حالی که ایشان مورد ستم قرار نگیرند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The earth will light up with the effulgence of her Lord; and the ledger (of account) will be placed (in each man's hand), and the apostles and the witnesses will be called, and judgement passed between them equitably, and no wrong will be done to them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And the earth will shine bright by the light of its Lord, and the Book will be established, and the Prophets and this Noble Prophet and the witnesses upon them from this nation will be brought, and it will be judged between them with the truth, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And the earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, and the Book shall be set in place, and the Prophets and witnesses shall be brought, and justly the issue be decided between them, and they not wronged.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the earth will gleam with the light of its Lord, and the Record shall be set up, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought and judgment will be given between them with truth, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord (Allah, when He will come to judge among men) and the Book will be placed (open) and the Prophets and the witnesses will be brought forward, and it will be judged between them with truth, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the earth will shine with the Light of its Lord; and the Book will be put in place; and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought in; and Judgment will be passed among them equitably, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, and the Scroll (of deeds) shall be set in place, and the Prophets and all witnesses shall be brought, and judgement shall be justly passed among them, and they shall not be wronged;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the Book will be presented, and the Prophets and the witnesses will be brought forward, and it will be judged between them with truth, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the earth shineth with the light of her Lord, and the Book is set up, and the prophets and the witnesses are brought, and it is judged between them with truth, and they are not wronged.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The earth will glow with the light of her Lord, and the Book will be set up, and the prophets and the martyrs will be brought, and judgment will be made between them with justice, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The earth will shine with the Light of its Lord, and the Book (of deeds) will be set (in place). The Prophets and witnesses shall be brought and the matter will be justly decided between them, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the record [of deeds] will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in truth, and they will not be wronged.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The earth will become bright from the light of your Lord. The Book of Records will be presented and the Prophets and witness will be summoned. All will be judged with justice and no wrong will be done to anyone.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the earth shall beam with the light of its Lord, and the Book shall be laid down, and the prophets and the witnesses shall be brought up, and judgment shall be given between them with justice, and they shall not be dealt with unjustly.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waashraqati alardu binoori rabbiha wawudiAAa alkitabu wajeea bialnnabiyyeena waalshshuhadai waqudiya baynahum bialhaqqi wahum la yuthlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the Book will be laid open; the prophets and witnesses will be brought in; and judgement will be passed on them with fairness. And none shall be wronged.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And the Earth will shine with the Glory of its Lord: the Record (of Deeds) will be placed (open); the prophets and the witnesses will be brought forward and a just decision pronounced between them; and they will not be wronged (in the least).

verses.text: وَ وُفِّيَتْ‌ کُلُ‌ نَفْسٍ‌ مَا عَمِلَتْ‌ وَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ‌ بِمَا يَفْعَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به هر کسی آنچه را انجام داده است، به طور کامل داده شود و او به کارهایی که انجام می دهند، داناتر است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پاداش هر كس برابر كردارش به تمامى ادا شود، در حالى كه خدا به كارهايى كه مى‌كرده‌اند آگاه‌تر است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به هر كس آنچه انجام داده به تمامى ادا شود، و خدا به آنچه مى‌كنند آگاه‌تر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هر كسى [نتيجه‌] آنچه انجام داده است به تمام بيابد و او به آنچه مى‌كنند داناتر است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هر کس به پاداش عملش تمام برسد و خدا از هر کس به افعال خلق آگاه‌تر است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و به تمام و کمال سزا و جزای هر کاری را که انسان کرده است بدو داده می‌شود، و خدا (از هر کس دیگری) بهتر می‌داند که آنان چه کارهائی را می‌کرده‌اند. [[«وُفِّیَتْ کُلُّ نَفْسٍ»: (نگا: آل‌عمران / 25). «هُوَ أَعْلَمُ ...»: مراد این است، احضار گواهان نه بدان خاطر است که اعمال مردم را برای خدا معلوم سازند. بلکه بدان خاطر است تا خود مردم کردارشان را به یاد آورند و با چشم خویش کِشته خویشتن را ببینند و گواهان بر آن گواهی دهند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به هر کس [جزای‌] آنچه کرده است به تمامی داده شود، و او [خداوند] به آنچه کرده‌اند داناتر است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به هر کس آنچه انجام داده است بی‌کم و کاست داده می‌شود؛ و او نسبت به آنچه انجام می‌دادند از همه آگاهتر است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و پرداخت شد به هر کس هر آنچه کرد و او داناتر است بدانچه می‌کنند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر كسى را آنچه كرده باشد تمام بدهند، و او داناتر است بدانچه مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به هر کسی آنچه انجام داده است بی‌کم و کاست (و برتر از آن) داده شد. و او به آنچه می‌کنند داناتر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Each soul will be paid in full for what it had done. He is cognisant of what you do.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And every soul will be repaid for its deeds in full, and He knows very well what they used to do.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Every soul shall be paid in full for what it has wrought; and He knows very well what they do.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And each soul will be paid in full that which it hath worked; and He is the Best Knower of which they do.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And each person will be paid in full of what he did; and He is Best Aware of what they do.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And every soul will be fully compensated for what it had done. He is well aware of what they do.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and everyone shall be paid in full for all that he did. Allah is best aware of all that they do.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And each person will be paid in full of what he did; and He is Best Aware of what they do.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And each soul is paid in full for what it did. And He is Best Aware of what they do.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Every soul will be recompensed fully for what it has done, and He is best aware of what they do.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Every soul shall be paid in full according to what it has done, for He knows well what they did.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it did; and He is most knowing of what they do.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Every soul will be recompensed for its deeds. God knows best whatever they have done.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And every soul shall be paid back fully what it has done, and He knows best what they do.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wawuffiyat kullu nafsin ma AAamilat wahuwa aAAlamu bima yafAAaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Every soul will be repaid in full for what it has done. He is fully aware of all that they did.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And to every soul will be paid in full (the fruit) of its Deeds; and (Allah) knoweth best all that they do.

verses.text: وَ سِيقَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا إِلَى‌ جَهَنَّمَ‌ زُمَراً حَتَّى‌ إِذَا جَاءُوهَا فُتِحَتْ‌ أَبْوَابُهَا وَ قَالَ‌ لَهُمْ‌ خَزَنَتُهَا أَ لَمْ‌ يَأْتِکُمْ‌ رُسُلٌ‌ مِنْکُمْ‌ يَتْلُونَ‌ عَلَيْکُمْ‌ آيَاتِ‌ رَبِّکُمْ‌ وَ يُنْذِرُونَکُمْ‌ لِقَاءَ يَوْمِکُمْ‌ هٰذَا قَالُوا بَلَى‌ وَ لٰکِنْ‌ حَقَّتْ‌ کَلِمَةُ الْعَذَابِ‌ عَلَى‌ الْکَافِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و کافران گروه گروه به دوزخ رانده می شوند، چون به دوزخ رسند درهایش گشوده شود و نگهبانانش به آنان گویند: آیا پیامبرانی از جنس خودتان به سویتان نیامدند که آیات پروردگارتان را بر شما بخوانند و شما را به دیدار این روزتان بیم دهند؟ گویند: آری، [آمدند] ولی فرمان عذاب بر کافران محقق و ثابت شدهاست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و كافران را گروه‌گروه به جهنم برانند. چون به جهنم رسند درهايش گشوده شود و نگهبانان آتش گويند: آيا پيامبرانى از خود شما بر شما مبعوث نشدند تا آيات پروردگارتان را برايتان بخوانند و شما را از ديدار با چنين روزى بترسانند؟ مى‌گويند: بلى. ولى، بر كافران عذاب محقق شده بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و كسانى كه كافر شدند، گروه گروه به سوى جهنّم رانده شوند. تا چون بدان جا رسند، درهاى آن [به رويشان‌] گشوده شود و نگهبانانش به آنها گويند: مگر فرستادگانى از خودتان به سوى شما نيامدند كه آيات پروردگارتان را بر شما بخوانند و به ديدار چنين روزى شما را هشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و كسانى كه كافر شده‌اند، گروه گروه به سوى جهنّم رانده شوند، تا چون بدان رسند، درهاى آن [به رويشان‌] گشوده گردد و نگهبانانش به آنان گويند: «مگر فرستادگانى از خودتان بر شما نيامدند كه آيات پروردگارتان را بر شما بخوانند و به ديدار چنين روزى شما را هشدار دهند؟» گويند: «چرا»، ولى فرمان عذاب بر كافران واجب آمد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آنان را که کافر شدند فوج فوج به جانب دوزخ رانند تا چون آنجا رسند درهای جهنّم (به رویشان) بگشایند و خازنان دوزخ به آنها گویند: مگر پیغمبرانی از خودتان برای (هدایت) شما نیامدند و آیات الهی را برایتان تلاوت نکردند و شما را از ملاقات این روز سخت نترسانیدند؟ جواب دهند: بلی و لیکن (افسوس که ما پند نگرفتیم و به کفر و عصیان خود را مستحق عذاب حرمان کردیم و) وعده عذاب بر کافران محقّق و حتمی گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و کافران به سوی دوزخ گروه گروه رانده می‌شوند و هنگامی که بدانجا رسیدند درهای آن به رویشان گشوده می‌گردد و نگهبانان دوزخ بدیشان می‌گویند: آیا پیغمبرانی از جنس خودتان به میانتان نیامده‌اند تا آیه‌های پروردگارتان را برای شما بخوانند و شما را از رویاروئی چنین روزی بترسانند؟ می‌گویند: آری! (پیغمبران برانگیخته شدند و اوامر و نواهی خدا را به ما رساندند و از عذاب آخرت بیممان دادند) ولیکن فرمان عذاب بر کافران ثابت و قطعی است (و ما راه کفر در پیش گرفتیم و باید هم تاوان آن را بپردازیم و چنین سرنوشت شومی داشته باشیم). [[«سِیقَ»: سوق داده شد. رانده شد. «زُمَراً»: جمع زُمْرَة، گروه گروه. فوج فوج. دسته دسته. «خَزَنَتُهَا»: خَزَنَة جمع خازِن، محافظان، نگهبانان. «رُسُلٌ مِّنکُمْ»: پیغمبرانی از جنس و نوع خودتان. مراد این است که پیغمبران به زبان خودتان شریعت را به شما تفهیم کرده‌اند. «أَلَمْ یَأْتِکُمْ رُسُلٌ مِّنکُمْ»: این پرسش جنبه توبیخ و تهدید دارد «حَقَّتْ کَلِمَةُ ...»: (نگا: یونس / 33 و 96، نحل / 36).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و کافران را گروه گروه به سوی جهنم برانند، چون به نزدیک آن رسند، درهایش بازگردد، و نگهبانان آن به ایشان گویند آیا پیامبران پروردگارتان به نزد شما نیامدند که بر شما آیات پروردگارتان را بخوانند، و شما را از دیدار این روزتان هشدار دهند، گویند چرا، ولی حکم عذاب بر کافران تحقق یافته است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و کسانی که کافر شدند گروه گروه به سوی جهنّم رانده می‌شوند؛ وقتی به دوزخ می‌رسند، درهای آن گشوده می‌شود و نگهبانان دوزخ به آنها می‌گویند: «آیا رسولانی از میان شما به سویتان نیامدند که آیات پروردگارتان را برای شما بخوانند و از ملاقات این روز شما را بر حذر دارند؟!» می‌گویند: «آری، (پیامبران آمدند و آیات الهی را بر ما خواندند، و ما مخالفت کردیم!) ولی فرمان عذاب الهی بر کافران مسلّم شده است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و رانده شدند آنان که کفر ورزیدند بسوی دوزخ گروه‌هایی تا گاهی که بیامدندش و گشوده شد درهایش و گفتند بدیشان نگهبانانش آیا نیامد شما را فرستادگانی از خود شما بسرایند بر شما آیتهای پروردگار شما را و بترسانندتان از رسیدنتان بدین روز گفتند بلی و لیکن راست آمد سرنوشت عذاب بر کافران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و كسانى كه كافر شدند گروه گروه به سوى دوزخ رانده شوند، تا چون بدانجا رسند درهاى آن گشوده شود و نگهبانان آن گويندشان: آيا شما را پيامبرانى از خودتان نيامدند كه آيات- سخنان و پيامهاى- پروردگارتان را بر شما مى‌خواندند و شما را از ديدار اين روزتان مى‌ترساندند؟ گويند: چرا- آمدند- و ليكن سخن- يعنى حكم- عذاب بر كافران سزا گشته است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و کسانی که کافر شدند گروه گروه سوی جهنم رانده شدند، تا هنگامی که بدان درآمدند، درهای آن (به رویشان) گشوده شد، و نگهبانانش به آنان گفتند: «مگر فرستادگانی از خودتان برایتان نیامدند حال آنکه آیات پروردگارتان را بر شما می‌خوانند و به دیدار چنین روزی شما را هشدار می‌دهند؟» گفتند: «چرا.» ولی فرمان عذاب بر کافران بحق فرود آمد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The unbelievers will be driven into Hell in groups till, when they reach it and its doors are opened up, its keepers will say to them: "Did not apostles of your own come to you reciting your Lord's revelations, warning you of this your day of Doom?" They will answer: "Yes;" but the sentence of punishment was justified against the unbelievers.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And the disbelievers will be herded towards hell in groups; to the extent that when they reach it, its gates will be opened, and its guards will say to them, “Did not the Noble Messengers come to you from amongst you, who used to recite to you the verses of your Lord and warn you of confronting this Day?” They will say, “Yes indeed, why not?” But the Word of punishment proved true upon the disbelievers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then the unbelievers shall be driven in companies into Gehenna till, when they have come thither, then its gates will be opened and its keepers will say to them, 'Did not Messengers come to you from among yourselves, reciting to you the signs of your Lord and warning you against the encounter of this your day?' They shall say, 'Yes indeed; but the word of the chastisement has been realized against the unbelievers.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And those who disbelieve will be driven onto Hell in troops till, when they arrive thereto, the portals thereof will be opened, and the keepers thereof will say Unto them: came there not Unto you apostles from amongst you, rehearsing Unto you the revelations of you Lord and warning you of the meeting of this your Day? They shall say: Yea, but the word of torment hath been justified on the Infidels.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups, till, when they reach it, the gates thereof will be opened (suddenly like a prison at the arrival of the prisoners). And its keepers will say, "Did not the Messengers come to you from yourselves, reciting to you the Verses of your Lord, and warning you of the Meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say: "Yes, but the Word of torment has been justified against the disbelievers!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in throngs. Until, when they have reached it, and its gates are opened, its keepers will say to them, “Did not messengers from among you come to you, reciting to you the revelations of your Lord, and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?” They will say, “Yes, but the verdict of punishment is justified against the disbelievers.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (After the judgement has been passed) the unbelievers shall be driven in companies to Hell so that when they arrive there, its gates shall be thrown open and its keepers shall say to them: “Did Messengers from among yourselves not come to you, rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord and warning you against your meeting of this Day?” They will say: “Yes indeed; but the sentence of chastisement was bound to be executed against the unbelievers.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups till when they reach it, the gates thereof will be opened. And its keepers will say: "Did not the Messengers come to you from yourselves, reciting to you the Ayat of your Lord, and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours" They will say: "Yes," but the Word of torment has been justified against the disbelievers!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And those who disbelieve are driven unto hell in troops till, when they reach it and the gates thereof are opened, and the warders thereof say unto them: Came there not unto you messengers of your own, reciting unto you the revelations of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this your Day? they say: Yea, verily. But the word of doom of disbelievers is fulfilled.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The faithless will be driven to hell in throngs. When they reach it and its gates are opened, its keepers will say to them, ‘Did there not come to you [any] apostles from among yourselves, reciting to you the signs of your Lord and warning you of the encounter of this day of yours?’ They will say, ‘Yes, but the word of punishment became due against the faithless.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: In companies the unbelievers shall be driven into Gehenna. As they draw near, its gates will be opened and its keepers will ask them: 'Did there not come to you Messengers of your own, who recited to you the verses of your Lord and warned you of the encounter of this your Day' 'Yes indeed' they will answer. And the word of the punishment has been realized against the unbelievers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups until, when they reach it, its gates are opened and its keepers will say, "Did there not come to you messengers from yourselves, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the word of punishment has come into effect upon the disbelievers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The disbelievers will be driven to hell in hordes. Its gates will be opened when they are brought nearby and the keepers will ask them, "Did Messengers from your own people not come to you to recite your Lord's revelations and to warn you about this day?" They will reply, "Yes, the Messengers did come to us, but the unbelievers were doomed to face the torment".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And those who disbelieve shall be driven to hell in companies; until, when they come to it, its doors shall be opened, and the keepers of it shall say to them: Did not there come to you apostles from among you reciting to you the communications of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this day of yours? They shall say: Yea! But the sentence of punishment was due against the unbelievers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waseeqa allatheena kafaroo ila jahannama zumaran hatta itha jaooha futihat abwabuha waqala lahum khazanatuha alam yatikum rusulun minkum yatloona AAalaykum ayati rabbikum wayunthiroonakum liqaa yawmikum hatha qaloo bala walakin haqqat kalimatu alAAathabi AAala alkafireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Those who rejected the truth will be led to Hell in throngs. When they reach it, its gates will be opened and its keepers will say to them, "Have messengers not come to you from among yourselves, who conveyed to you the revelations of your Lord and warned you about meeting [Him] on this Day?" They will answer, "Yes, they did come." But the decree of punishment has proved true against the deniers of the truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The Unbelievers will be led to Hell in crowd: until, when they arrive, there, its gates will be opened. And its keepers will say, "Did not messengers come to you from among yourselves, rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord, and warning you of the Meeting of This Day of yours?" The answer will be: "True: but the Decree of Punishment has been proved true against the Unbelievers!"

verses.text: قِيلَ‌ ادْخُلُوا أَبْوَابَ‌ جَهَنَّمَ‌ خَالِدِينَ‌ فِيهَا فَبِئْسَ‌ مَثْوَى‌ الْمُتَکَبِّرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [به آنان] گویند: از درهای دوزخ درآیید در حالی که در آن جاودانه اید؛ پس جایگاه متکبران چه بد جایگاهی است؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفته شود: از درهاى جهنم داخل شويد، همواره در آنجا خواهيد بود. جايگاه سركشان چه بد جايگاهى است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و گفته شود: از درهاى دوزخ داخل شويد و جاودانه در آن بمانيد، پس بد است جايگاه متكبران

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
